Absolutely stunning, life-changing game. The mix of calm music and the intense fighting of the ducks really gives this game a superb feel. The wide selection of ducks make for a humorous time with all of their silly costumes and weird mechanics. In addition to this, the maps allow for a dynamic and engaging experience with their interesting designs and fun features. The graphics add on to this already beautiful game, lifting it to a whole other level. Overall, this game provides some laughs and a calming, serene experience for any person. 10/10 deserves game of the year.

i like th duck

I had no clue what to expect as many of these reviews are either funny one liners or describe some epic saga and... I think they all fit. This game is whatever you make of it. It's ultimately a pool full of ducks and physics mechanics, with some fun, occasionally repetitive, soothing background music. Sometimes weird stuff happens. The controls can be a little wonky but, relax, it's just ducks. 

I have a really hard time focusing on work when I'm feeling down, and have that terrible habit of resorting to social media (which of course never helps) for some dopamine. Placid ducks is replacing that for me. I'm keeping it running while I work today, and the mild, not too interesting music is perfect to work to, and checking in on how my ducks are doing between tasks is giving me that sweet, sweet dopamine without sucking me into a twitter argument. 

I think I'll stream this and name ducks after my subscribers. My only wish is that we could finagle the timer on when ducks drop - I work in pomodoro shifts and I'd really love to set the timer to drop a duck every time it's time to take a pomo break, letting the splash sound be a trigger that it's breaktime. 

I'm glad I got this on sale and got all the DLC, it's work the $6 but would have felt like too much for what it is at $12.

This isn't a game. This is a glimpse into the fragility of man that will take you on a journey of inner peace and introspection. It combines the beauty and density of a game like Red Dead Redemption 2 and the heart-wrenching, edge of your seat decision making of The Last of Us. Never before have I had a game that has taught me more about myself. This is a must have game, nay, experience that will make you a better person. It will  make us all better people, and by extension, the world better.

The first rubber ducks didn't even float: they were cast solid and intended as chew toys. By the 1940s, rubber ducks developed into the iconic floating yellow figure with bright orange bill we recognize today. For many decades, most duck figures have been made of vinyl, but in this game they are made of absolutely fucking anything. 

10/10 will watch these spectacular duckies for hours üëçüèª

Ducks are love, ducks are life.

In my current possession, I find myself in the fortunate and rather peculiar position of being the custodian of a highly sophisticated, meticulously crafted simulacrum that closely resembles a representative of the avian kingdom, more precisely a rubber duck. This seemingly innocuous object, borne from the annals of playful capriciousness, accompanies me with a sense of gravitas and serves as my unwavering and peripatetic companion.

With an air of facetiousness, I have bestowed upon this inanimate yet strangely animate-looking entity the epithet of "my quixotically quacking compatriot." This nomenclatural whimsy, despite its seemingly lighthearted nature, belies the remarkable and enigmatic role that this effigy plays in the tapestry of my daily existence.

It is nothing short of a marvel how this unassuming rubber duck, this epitome of synthetic avian grace, has become a veritable fulcrum for the initiation and sustenance of diverse and intricate dialogues within the rich tapestry of my quotidian interactions. Its presence, perched as it is upon the precipice of novelty and absurdity, serves as a lighthouse amidst the turbulent seas of conversational mediocrity.

Moreover, what adds an extra layer of intrigue to this whimsical situation is the fact that my "quixotically quacking compatriot" has not merely remained confined to the sphere of my personal affairs. In the age of the digital diaspora, it has birthed its own digital identity, flourishing on the global stage of Instagram, where it stands as a beacon to those who share in the esoteric and specialized domain of rubber avian connoisseurs.

This online presence has not only given rise to an ever-expanding and devout cohort of aficionados but has also served as a testament to the boundless potential of the internet to amplify and magnify the idiosyncrasies of human existence, no matter how trivial or surreal they may be.

In sum, my possession of this erudite avian effigy, this rubber duck, transcends mere ownership; it encapsulates the essence of whimsy, absurdity, and the power of the human penchant for storytelling and community-building in the most unexpected of places, be it the tangible world that I navigate daily or the boundless digital realm where the boundaries of shared experience continue to expand beyond the ordinary and into the extraordinary.

"Close your eyes." a voice says. You, acknowledging this, close them. You hear a calm voice say "imagine a duck." and then, there in the darkness, is a duck, a lonely duck just sitting there, but before you can understand why you are thinking of a duck, the voice calls out again. "Now, imagine a LOT of ducks.. SO many ducks. Enough ducks to take up all your thoughts." confused, you comply and think of as many ducks as you can. Your brain is starting to hurt from all the ducks that you're thinking about. "let the ducks in, they need you, you are duckmanitys only hope for survival." the voice says. before you can respond the voice starts speaking again. "You are the chosen one, the ducks chose YOU specifically... Do you agree to help them?...." you try to speak but nothing happens, like the ducks are already taking over, "yes? .....thank you." says the voice. "Do you see them?" yes, I do see them, the ducks are overwhelming, all I can think of is ducks.. as your thinking about the amount of ducks, it gets too overwhelming and you open your eyes and look around, but you notice something is off.. you realize you are now in a pool floating around, you can't move, you try to look down.. but nothing happens, you realize you have turned into one of the plastic ducks, stuck in this pool forever, floating for eternity.. but, it feels.. calming? But as soon as you get comfortable with this new life, you hear something, something that sounds like a voice, basically yelling at you at this point, like its been trying to get your attention for awhile now. it seems to be coming from nowhere. you hear the voice tell you to open your eyes..? "but my eyes are open!!" you say yelling out loud. but as you say that you realize your eyes are still closed and you forgot to open them-.. you open your eyes to realize you started daydreaming at your therapy appointment, your therapist, concerned, asks.. "are you okay? I told you to imagine your favorite place and then you stopped responding for a few minutes. did you get lost in your favorite place?" You tell your therapist you were in your favorite place, a place that is very special to you. Being a plastic duck in a pool.. (This is what I assume its like when a teacher or a therapist ask you to close your eyes and imagine your safe/favorite place, because I wouldn't know, I have a aphantasia)

You need this game. You might think "Why would I want to stare at ducks all day?" the truth is that this game is the ultimate crowd pleaser. At a family gathering and its a bit quiet? Throw this on the TV. Everyone will want to name a duck, to watch one specific one, to revel in the sheer absurdity of spending money to watch virtual ducks in a pool. There will be arguments on what the name of a duck will be. Shaboingus was named in a fierce and tidal battle of words and wit. 

I love this game. I love what it stands for and its purpose in the gaming landscape. In a sea of Action Shooters and deep narrative RPGs, wouldn't it be nice to just watch some ducks for an hour or two?
If you like rubber ducks, then you'll like this game.

I don't normally do reviews for the games I play, but I HAD to make an exception just this one time.
When I first tried playing it, it not only crashed, but it made my whole Laptop completely shut off. I was also worried that it had done actual physical damage to it somehow, because not only did it struggle to restart, but for several minutes after, it just, wouldn't charge, even though it was plugged in. I tried again a little while after but got the exact same result, plus it happened even quicker, as soon as I selected the profile to start playing.
I was promised a relaxing time, but all I got was panic & dread, worrying that several hundred dollars of mine had gone down the drain, all because of a severely unoptimized game about watching rubber ducks float around in a pool.

Wow, what an unexpectedly delightful journey I've had with Placid Plastic Duck Simulator! Clocking in at a serene 51 hours, this game has provided me with an oasis of tranquility unlike any other.

From the moment I dipped my toes into its calm waters, I found myself immersed in a world of pure bliss.  The serene ambiance, coupled with the soothing soundtrack, whisked me away from the stresses of everyday life into a realm of pure relaxation.

But what truly sets Placid Plastic Duck Simulator apart is its incredible community. Upon joining the Discord, I was greeted with open arms by fellow duck enthusiasts who share my passion for serene gaming experiences. The camaraderie, and positivity within this community are infectious, making every moment spent in-game all the more enjoyable.

And let's not forget about the achievements! For those who, like me, enjoy unlocking every last accomplishment, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator offers a satisfying array of challenges to conquer. 

In conclusion, I cannot recommend Placid Plastic Duck Simulator highly enough. Whether you're in need of a relaxing escape or simply seeking a welcoming community to call home, this game has it all. So hop on your duck, join the flock, and prepare for a quacktastic adventure unlike any other!

There is no inherent goal or meaning to this game. No matter how long you play, you can't "win" or even improve. And yet, we can be content with this. The meaningless nature of the game allows us to choose why or if it matters, and to what ends. Acceptance of this fact brings a paradoxical sense of freedom that is a useful and poetic microcosm of our lives. Thus, one must imagine Atlus happy.

I've never believed in idle games as a concept. If you're going to watch and not play something why not just watch a movie or a youtube video.
These ducks however... it's surprisingly relaxing and enjoyable to watch them bob around and bump into each other. No need for action, no gameplay to accompany the ducks even if i wanted to. I like seeing a new duck spawn and how the achievements are linked to what would be gameplay but is instead pretty much just random chance. I like having the ducks on in the background while i do other tasks like cleaning or yoga.

If you are a fan of (plastic) ducks or idle games then I recommend this "game". If you want a glorified screensaver for the background , I also recommend this "game".  :)

It's a simple game by nature and I love having so many fun designs for the little ducks. I like to do this in the background while I'm busy with other things on the computer because I find it relaxing. Picking out names for each of the duckies every now and then just makes me smile.

So this is what I've come to. Instead of staring down the abyss of a meaningless existence or scrolling through soul-drenching social media apps, I'm watching pixelated plastic ducks float around like the DVD logo bounces in an erroneous attempt to hit the upper corner of a TV screen. 

To me, this game is like Dark Souls. Relaxing and soothing. I enjoy floating aimlessly with my duckies, sipping from a Desperados, while my manager drags me into a call, spending 5 minutes evaluating my KPIs while the rest of the 55 minutes are dedicated towards her presenting me the latest additions to her pan and cutlery collections. Realize that life is meaningless and the duckies already know it.

I have just finished the campaign. The boss was very difficult, but there were levels before it that explained the controls in a detailed, yet understandable way. The graphics are sophisticated and detailed. 
However, i feel like this game would benefit from an option to create your own pools where you can fight an epic rubber duck boss with your friends, to relive the wonderful feeling that you got when beating the final boss. Replayability is a swell thing. Great game, 11/10, just needs some more user content. Very difficult but easy to understand and learn.

I removed my soul, and put it in a duck.

The duck (containing my soul) decided to go down a slide.

A snow plow violently catapulted the duck (containing my soul) onto the mountain cliffs.

Limbus Company (one of the other ducks) was there.

We snowboarded down the mountain until the fog swallowed us.

I waited in the darkness.

Eventually, I heard a sound.

There was the cable car, lowering into the mist.

It lifted me out of the darkness, and out of the fog.

I saw Markiplier (he is also one of the ducks) waiting at the ice rink to board.

We rode to the top of the cable-car, and the floor fell out from under us.

We splashed into the pleasantly still pool.

Now my next life as a placid plastic duck can continue in absolute tranquillity (true story!).

Placid plastic duck simulator is more than just a mere game. It is the culmination of generations of humanities greatest minds all coming together to create an experience that is second to nothing. This game has changed the lives of countless people and we as a collective have barely scratched the surface of the mystical powers this game has to offer to our society. More people need to know about this, spread the word that the holy spirit has arrived on earth and tell them all that it is in the form of placid plastic duck simulator.

I've been looking for a game like this, and I wasn't disappointed I really enjoyed playing the game and idling with all the rubber duckies. I also enjoyed the DLC content with 2 different maps and rubber ducks that they included, so I'm really looking forward to any more DLC's in the future.

10/10 highly recommend this game, if your looking for a chill relaxing game.
ducks are so cool i wish they were real
Addicting, i love ducks :3

I bought this game because I have a gray glitter rubber duck. I wish I could collect them, but I don't want to hoard. So, I found this game. I thought this was just sit back and watch the sitting ducks float around. When I minimized the screen, I heard a lot of splashing and maximized the screen; The ducks were floating quietly. Somehow, I earned a badge for popping a flamingo by one of those ducks. I don't know who the duck did it. So, I moved to the Duck game window on the second display. After I placed it on a second display, the ducks were bouncing by themselves. That explains the whole thing. I would recommend this game to anyone who like rubber ducks.

those who fear the unknown are often the same who refuse to acknowledge its awe-inspiring potential. 

pp duck simulator shows you why those people are [i]wrong[/i].
my life i reol to rubber uck in pool in rlity jue  t out of rche

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a fast paced, action packed adventure game where  if you blink, you will DEFINITELY miss the action. Quack.

The game features 3 breathtaking maps, the Infinity Pool, Quacking the Ice, and Hippospace. 2/3 the maps are DLC bound so you'll have to aquire to appropriate DLC's to be able to go to those maps. And each map has its own set of unique ducklings but in a long run you'll have them all! Like the famous line says, Gotta catch them all!

One time, I saw the most beautiful piece of cinema. It was a story about love, compassion, evolution. The red, green, and blue jelly ducklings had a task and a very difficult task indeed. Among a sea of ducklings, they have to find and reunite themselves in order to create the ultimate being. Once they all reunited, the ceremony begins and the ritual starts. The 3 jelly ducklings must combine their powers, this emerging the ultimate being. Big Jelly Duck. The ultimate duck. The mightest duck. All the heavens into one, Big Jelly duck.

And now here's a duck

I must say, I was skeptical when I first heard about the game 'Placid Plastic Duck Simulator.' I mean, how exciting could a game about a plastic ducks be? But oh boy, was I wrong. From the minute I booted up the game, I was hooked. 
The graphics were top-notch, I could practically see the plastic sheen on the ducks' feathers. The game play was smooth and intuitive, I felt like I was truly a plastic duck floating in a pond. 
But it wasn't just the technical  aspects that drew me in, oh no. It was the sheer ridiculousness of the game. I mean, who would have thought that watching a plastic duck could be so entertaining? I spent hours just waddling around, quacking at other plastic ducks, and causing general chaos in the pool. And let me tell you, it's a stress-free life being a plastic duck. No bills to pay, no responsibilities, just floating and quacking. 
Overall, I would give Placid Plastic Duck Simulator a solid 10 out of 10. It's ridiculous, nonsensical, and just plain fun. Plus, who doesn't love a good plastic duck? Trust me, you won't regret getting quacking with this game.

a true masterpiece

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is an absolute masterpiece in the realm of minimalist gaming. From the moment you launch the game, you're transported into a world of tranquil beauty, where simplicity reigns supreme. The game's core mechanic, watching rubber ducks serenely float in gently rippling water, is executed with such finesse that it becomes a meditative experience.

The graphics are stunningly realistic, making each duck's journey across the calm waters a visual treat. The attention to detail in the water's texture and the ducks' movements is nothing short of spectacular. This game isn't just about observing; it's about feeling the peacefulness that each floating duck brings.

The sound design deserves special mention. The soft sounds of water and the subtle, relaxing quacks of the ducks create an ambient symphony that soothes the soul. It's the perfect background noise for unwinding after a long day or for finding a moment of peace in a hectic schedule.

What sets Placid Plastic Duck Simulator apart is its ability to make something so simple feel so profound. There are no levels, no scores, just the endless delight of watching these charming rubber ducks embark on their endless, peaceful journey. This game is a reminder of the beauty in simplicity, a digital oasis in our complex world.

In conclusion, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is more than a game; it's a therapeutic experience. It invites players to slow down, breathe, and enjoy the moment. Whether you're a gamer looking for a change of pace or someone seeking a slice of tranquility, this game is a must-try. It's a shining example of how minimalism can lead to a deeply satisfying and enriching experience.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a deceptively addictive game - the longer you stick around its relaxing environments, watching the waters bob and listening to the radio tunes, the more ducks will spawn in, each with their own unique design. Some will even have their own quacks, or special abilities! The pufferfish, that puffs up when touched, the ghost, who I apparently have but is completely invisible - the fire-breathing godzilla duck, who sets the plaid duck on fire because it happens to be cloth.

I will not rest from this game. The hours will keep ticking, up until I have completed every achievement, have unlocked every duck, and have finally found out what lies behind those secret, locked doors. The answer must lie in the radio whispers I hear every now and then.

The ducks know. They're coming for me.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is the game you never knew you needed in your life ‚Äì until now. Move over high-intensity action games and mind-bending puzzles; it's time to embark on a quack-filled adventure that will leave you questioning your life choices in the best possible way.

From the moment you boot up the game, you're greeted by a serene pond with a cast of characters that could rival any A-list Hollywood lineup ‚Äì plastic ducks. Yes, you read that right. Plastic ducks. But don't let their immobile appearance fool you; these ducks are about to take you on a wild ride.

The gameplay is simple yet strangely addictive. Your mission? Waddle around the pond, quack at random intervals, and engage in heated debates with your fellow plastic comrades about the meaning of life. It's like a philosophical symposium with feathers.

The graphics are surprisingly realistic ‚Äì if you're into photorealistic plastic duck simulations, that is. The developers spared no expense in capturing the essence of a tranquil pond, complete with algae-covered rocks and the occasional leaf drifting by. The attention to detail is quacking impressive.

One of the game's standout features is the quack customization. Yes, you can personalize your duck's quack to suit your mood. Feeling sassy? Choose the sassy quack. Feeling mysterious? Opt for the mysterious quack. The possibilities are as endless as the pond itself.

The multiplayer mode is where Placid Plastic Duck Simulator truly shines. Team up with friends to form the most elite quacking squad, or engage in intense quack-offs to determine who is the ultimate quack master. Just be warned ‚Äì the quack competition is fierce, and friendships may be tested.

While the game offers hours of quacktastic entertainment, it does have a few drawbacks. The lack of a storyline leaves you questioning the purpose of your plastic existence, and the absence of a quack-to-English translator can make communication with your fellow ducks a bit challenging.

In conclusion, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a quack-filled rollercoaster of hilarity that will have you questioning the meaning of life, one quack at a time. If you've ever dreamed of living the plastic duck life, this game is a must-play. Just be prepared to quack your way to victory and ponder the deep philosophical questions that come with being a plastic waterfowl. Quack on, my friends, quack on.

Where do I even begin with "Placid Plastic Duck Simulator"? By the gods of the digital waters, this isn't just a game ‚Äì it's a transcendental journey into the serene life of plastic ducks. Imagine, if you will, the zenith of gaming, the magnum opus of simulators, the very pinnacle of what it means to replicate the enthralling existence of the most majestic inanimate waterfowl. This, my friends, is it!

I've spent eons, or what feels like it, gazing upon the hypnotic beauty of my glossy avian companions, floating without a care upon pixelated ponds that reflect the heavens themselves. You begin to understand that this is not just pixels on a screen. No, it's a philosophical expedition; it‚Äôs the search for inner peace amidst the maelstrom of our daily lives.

"Placid Plastic Duck Simulator" lulls you into a state of harmony with its revolutionary lack of objectives. The purpose? You are a duck - no, you *become* the duck. Feel the gentle waves generated by your soul echoing through the duck's undisturbed world. It's not about the destination; it's about the meditative journey of doing absolutely quack-all.

Each frame of this game could be hung in the Louvre, and the Mona Lisa herself would weep at the sight. Dynamic lighting cascades over every curve of your plastic body. The sunsets? They‚Äôre a chef's kiss to the retina - an explosion of colors that would make Van Gogh toss his palette and declare, ‚ÄúI can never top that!‚Äù

The symphonic soundscape is a minimalist masterpiece. You'll hear the soothing whispers of the wind, the occasional belle of a distant buoy, and of course, the dulcet, plastic *plop* of your duck breaching the surface tension of reality. Wear headphones, and you might just reach enlightenment.

Each time you return, the game whispers a new secret into your very soul. Perhaps it is the quiver of a new water ripple, or a shift in the gentle floating mechanics. Eternal, like the ocean's waves, "Placid Plastic Duck Simulator" invites you to drift into its endless cycle of serene simulation.

In conclusion, if you do not find yourself downloading "Placid Plastic Duck Simulator" at this very moment, then, my fellow gamer, you have not yet discovered the true meaning of life. Cast aside your shooters and strategems, and embrace the placidity of your new digital anatidae deity.

[h1] A must-have game if you like ducks [/h1]

[b] [i] I recommend this game for those that love ducks. It's a very relaxing game about watching ducks /  scenery. you can choose which duck to watch by clicking on it, or choose between fixed camera points (you can click on some objects to change camera position).  [/i] [/b]

Ducks will automatically spawn after some time, one duck at a time except for some events that happens randomly in the game. 

There is a nice variety of ducks in the base game.

Some ducks will make distinct sounds when you do a left click on them, It's nice.

There is only one map in the base game at the writing of this review, and while the base map looks really cool and has some nice events, it can get stale because there is not much variety in there and the map is really small, which is a bit sad, I think there should be at least 3 maps in the base game, and two maps for each DLC with more detail on it, that's my only complaint that I have about it. 

Despite what I've already said about only one map, if you are planning to use it as a background or just to relax with the sounds and ducks floating around, then it should be fine, but I still think there should be more variety in the base map or 2 other maps in the base game.

The Radio in the base map has some good songs, I also love the voice recordings in there, It's kinda funny, it fits really well with the map and the ducks altogether.

[i] Options: You have graphics option to optimize fps if that's an issue. You can give each duck a name, disable duck spawn, and disable music (the radio).  [/i]

[b] Overall, I really recommend this game, It's very cute and relaxing. Again, a must-have for those that like ducks [/b]

Let‚Äôs talk a little about Placid Plastic Duck Simulator. This is a hella charming idle game, loosely based on an actual real life event. Which I‚Äôll link a story about here:

https://www.npr.org/2011/03/29/134923863/moby-duck-when-28-800-bath-toys-are-lost-at-sea

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3079029016

The game is set in the backyard of an isolated vacation home located on a tiny island‚Ä¶.somewhere in the ocean. And in that backyard is a pool party, replete with a two deck pool, a pool slide, some deck chairs, floaties, a tiny gedo blaster for some sick tunes and a bit of news, beer, and those sweet ocean views. It‚Äôs basically a Corona commercial, lol.

And by party, I mean a Duck party. One by one, a variety of ducks drop into the pool from‚Ä¶.somewhere. You can quack the ducks, many of whom have some unique quacks, and you can control the camera with three different points of view around the pool as well as one duck focused camera, which you can use to scroll through your ducks to see what they‚Äôre up to. And you also have zoom camera controls.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3093327786

The ducks themselves (mostly) float around soaking in the ambiance. Some have some special abilities, such as short distance flight, breathing fire, putting out fires, and so on. There is a day/night cycle, weather cycles, and also special events such as ships passing by, UFOs kidnapping ducks, etc‚Ä¶

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3079028671

My favorite duck is the Ace Frehley duck, who offers a sweet guitar lick as its quack.

This game is Steam Deck compatible.

And that‚Äôs a pretty fair summation of the base game. This game makes me chuckle and brings a smile to my face. You basically just fire up the game, Duck and Chill. A nicer alternative to screen savers. The game would benefit from either a wider song selection or the ability to play your own tunes, but otherwise, it's a flawless experience.

Quacktastic Voyage: A Whimsical Adventure with Placid Plastic Duck Simulator

Prepare to embark on a delightful journey into the world of whimsy with Placid Plastic Duck Simulator, a game that seamlessly blends charm, creativity, and pure quackery. From the moment you waddle into the virtual pond, you'll find yourself captivated by the sheer joy and absurdity that this game has to offer.

The graphics are a feast for the eyes, with vibrant colors and attention to detail that make the plastic ducks come to life in a way you never thought possible. The developers have truly nailed the art of turning the mundane into the extraordinary, transforming the simple act of bobbing in a pond into a visually stunning experience. The reflections on the water, the way the sunlight dances off the plastic feathers ‚Äì it's a visual treat that will leave you grinning from ear to ear.

But Placid Plastic Duck Simulator isn't just about looks; it's about the immersive gameplay that hooks you from the get-go. The controls are intuitive, allowing even the most novice gamers to navigate their duck through various challenges. Whether it's racing against other quackers, solving whimsical puzzles, or engaging in friendly banter with fellow plastic waterfowl, every moment is a quacktastic adventure.

The soundtrack is a masterpiece in itself, with a whimsical blend of cheerful tunes that perfectly complements the game's lighthearted atmosphere. From the soothing melodies as you drift lazily through the pond to the upbeat tempos during intense races, the music adds an extra layer of enjoyment to the overall experience.

One of the standout features of Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is the customization options available for your plastic protagonist. With a plethora of accessories, hats, and quirky outfits to choose from, you can truly make your duck stand out in the crowded pond. The attention to detail in these customization options showcases the developers' commitment to providing players with a unique and personal gaming experience.

The multiplayer mode takes the quackery to a whole new level. Compete with friends or join a flock of players from around the world as you navigate challenges together, creating memories that will leave you laughing and quacking in unison. The multiplayer aspect adds a social element to the game, turning Placid Plastic Duck Simulator into a delightful communal experience.

In conclusion, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a triumph of creativity, offering a refreshing break from the typical gaming fare. It's a testament to the fact that a game doesn't need complex plots or cutting-edge graphics to be captivating ‚Äì sometimes, all it takes is a bunch of plastic ducks, a pond, and a whole lot of quirkiness. So, if you're looking for a game that will bring a smile to your face and a quack to your heart, dive into the delightful world of Placid Plastic Duck Simulator. It's an absolute quacktastic voyage that shouldn't be missed!

This was a fun one-off experience I‚Äôll leave for the biggest ‚Äúrelaxing‚Äù and ‚Äúcollectathon‚Äù tags fans. Of which there are many, judging by the amount of overwhelmingly positive reviews. PDS was an experimental try for me, as I‚Äôm not into either of those tags, but it seemed hilariously silly, visually stylish and with a promise of mysteries that one might need to dig into. 

It did deliver on all those accounts. For example:

-	Not just the premise is rather wacky, but the game manages to be highly self-aware of said wackiness, without a single action or a line of dialogue. Just quacks.

-	It‚Äôs hard to imagine anyone who won‚Äôt be chuckling/grinning or ‚Äúawwww‚Äù-ing once the ducks start appearing. They are cute. Including the one with a knife.

-	There is a super-stylish sunrise-to-sunset loop going on, and it‚Äôs visually striking. It also makes you desperately want to take a vacation.  

-	There‚Äôs pretty cool soundtrack coming out of the radio ‚Äì a mix of news/ads/shows and snazzy tunes in different languages. Some are seriously amping up that anxious desire for a faraway vacation which has already blossomed to epic proportions ‚Äì once you noticed a cruise ship in the purple setting sun.

-	There are, indeed, some deeper mysteries going on that require quite a bit of observation skills and a good thinking cap on, some of which, from my understanding, are still ongoing and haven‚Äôt been solved as of this writing.

Essentially, there‚Äôs fun to be had all around‚Ä¶ IF you‚Äôre willing to simply stare at your screen for hours. The ducks appear at certain time intervals on their own (the further into the game the longer it takes), and there isn‚Äôt anything active you can do as a player besides picking them up, pressing a button to hear them quack or naming them. That‚Äôs it. There are a few vantage points you can choose to watch the pool from, but that‚Äôs what you‚Äôll be ultimately doing the whole game ‚Äì watching them. Or you can opt to do some cleaning, cooking or working-out while ducks steadily populate your pool with a background of starry night or sunny afternoon. It‚Äôs very chill and not very engaging. With such a low interactivity point, PDS technically doesn‚Äôt need you to play it at all ‚Äì it does a fine job of it on its own.

And this, in turn, seems to be totally cool with a great number of people, so I almost feel like I missed out on some great secret. What do all these people enjoy so much? How can they seem to be so engaged? Man, WHAT IS IT that I‚Äôm not seeing? Ugh. I‚Äôll just leave this one for the cool kids that know how to relax with their games and go point‚Äôn‚Äôclick myself to exhaustion or mindlessly mash some buttons just to feel alive. What a loser!

"Placid Plastic Duck Simulator" is a whimsical journey into the heart of duckdom, where serenity meets hilarity in the most unexpected ways. The concept of not being able to control the plastic duck might sound like a departure from traditional gaming, but it's this very lack of control that makes the game a true standout in the pond of gaming experiences.

From the moment you dip your webbed feet into the virtual pond, the simplicity of the graphics draws you into a tranquil world of plastic paradise. The placid water, the gentle ripples, and the plastic sheen of the ducks create a visually pleasing environment that's oddly calming, setting the perfect stage for the unpredictable chaos that ensues.

The spawning of a new plastic duck every five minutes is a stroke of genius. It keeps the gameplay fresh, ensuring that each session is a new adventure. The diverse cast of ducks, each with its own special ability, adds a layer of hilarity to the mix. Whether it's watching a duck shoot water with playful precision, witnessing a fiery fowl breathe fire in the most plastic way imaginable, or marveling at a propeller hat duck take flight, the creativity in the special abilities adds a delightful twist to the otherwise placid pond setting.

The lack of control over the ducks surprisingly becomes part of the game's charm. It's a testament to the developers' ingenuity that the unpredictability doesn't lead to frustration but rather to a sense of joyful anticipation. The interactions between the plastic ducks create a dynamic and comical environment, turning the pond into a stage for a lighthearted and entertaining spectacle.

"Placid Plastic Duck Simulator" is more than just a game; it's an experience that invites players to embrace the unexpected, to find joy in the simplicity of plastic ducks, and to appreciate the humor that can be found in the most placid of settings. It's a game that proves that sometimes, letting go of control can lead to the most quacktastic adventures. If you're looking for a delightful escape into the world of plastic whimsy, this game is an absolute gem that'll leave you quacking with joy.

I bought this game as a gift for two friends previously, while not picking it up for myself. After hearing their resounding quacks of approval, I took the next chance I had to get a copy of my own.
I will tell you this video game, no, this life experience, is a surefire way to get your ducks in a row. It's not much, but that's the point. There's not much to do but take a little waddle around the pool while taking in those serene creatures and I wouldn't have it any other way. Rubber duckies single-handedly took away the need of ever going to therapy. Occasionally another duck will fall from the heavens like an angel into my lovely ducky pool, and I get significantly more ecstatic. I've never been so happy. 
The quackophony from those countless rubber bills feels like a feather in your hat. My mouse has never seen so many clicks as it's seen making these ducks sing their songs. 

10/10 experience I will remember for a quacking long time.

I highly recommend this game for people who want something running in the background! It has just enough "things" going on to be engaging to briefly look at but boring if stared at for hours. Each duck appears in about 8 to 9 minutes and each duck is well thought-out and very unique, with different textures, colors, props, clothing, skins, and actual things they can do, such as flying or spraying water. You don't control anything but the camera, so this game is clearly meant for those who want to relax and watch the ducks bump into each other. All 3 maps are filled with little secrets and easter eggs, clearly the developers have put in a lot of time creating these maps and the ducks as well. Music is relaxing and casual too. :)

I got this game without knowing what to expect, it also used to have the "psychological horror" tag which got me interested, but now it's gone and it seems like it was wrong. Is the game is relaxing? yeah I guess, but there's not that much to do, and the vibes of the game made it look like it was filled with secrets, and there is an interactive one, but the only secret in this game (Door with code) is locked behind a DLC, just like most of the achievements, so I can't even 100% complete the game.

The game itself isn't a whole lot in terms of interactivity, but there are some secrets lurking in the shadows. That said, the soundtrack that plays on the radio is simply amazing. I will put it on when I clean the house and listen to it on repeat.

I enjoyed letting it run while I occasionally checked in to see what nonsense the ducks were up to this time as well as what new ducks had joined the party.

The soundtrack that plays on the base/main radio station is NOT the music available on what is listed as the OST on Spotify and elsewhere. Not Bandcamp either. I've found it on YouTube but nowhere else. My game never would let me change the radio station but I've seen videos of others doing it. Perhaps this is where the other music comes from, but I learned to love just the starting station loop and I don't think I need anything more.

Bought it for the ducks, stayed for the music. I'm a bit surprised but I totally recommend this goofy, $1.99 game.

[b]Overview:[/b]

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a game where you watch ducks spawn in a pool, and get a different one each time, you can also name your ducks, you can't move them around or anything though, just purely watching and naming ducks, it's a funny and unique concept, it's also pretty cute and for a cheap price of $1.99 it was worth it to buy!


[b]Downsides:[/b]

This game can get boring because you are pretty much just watching ducks spawn and getting badges, that's the exact pure reason of this game, and although it's a unique and cute concept it does get boring.

It's also pretty annoying that you can't control your ducks, you can't move them around or anything, they kinda just float where ever they want to.

But this game is still unique and cute, I by no means play it all the time but it's cute.


|---------------------------------|

Fun: 7.3 / 10

Challenging: 0 / 10

Boring: 7.6 / 10

Thrilling: 4.6 / 10

|---------------------------------|

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is an absolute revelation in the world of gaming, offering an exquisite and unmatched experience that captivates players from the very first moment. In a medium often characterized by adrenaline-pumping action and complex narratives, this game dares to be different, providing a serene and meditative journey that is nothing short of perfection. With its elegant simplicity and the mesmerizing charm of watching ducks in a pool, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator earns its rightful place as a 10/10 masterpiece.

The gameplay of Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is deceptively simple, yet it possesses an undeniable allure that is impossible to resist. In this tranquil oasis of a game, you are tasked with doing nothing more than watching a pool filled with plastic ducks. Every minute or so, a new duck gracefully spawns into the pool, adding to the serene spectacle. There are no scores to chase, no enemies to defeat, and no objectives to complete‚Äîjust pure, unadulterated duck-watching bliss.

Visually, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a triumph of minimalist design. The pool, adorned with its plastic inhabitants, is rendered with exquisite attention to detail, creating a visually pleasing tableau that invites you to lose yourself in its simplicity. The ducks themselves, despite their apparent uniformity, display a wide range of colors, patterns, and refrences, with most of them having unique gimmicks.

The sound design is equally masterful, with gentle water ripples and the occasional quack creating an immersive soundscape that enhances the overall ambiance. It's a sensory symphony that envelops you in a state of peaceful immersion, making every minute spent in the game a precious moment of tranquility.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is more than just a game; it's a meditative experience that beckons players to embrace tranquility and mindfulness. In a world marked by the relentless pace of modern life, this game offers a precious respite. Watching the ducks serenely go about their business in the pool becomes an exercise in relaxation and living in the moment. It's an opportunity to let go of stress and simply be.

What truly sets Placid Plastic Duck Simulator apart is its unapologetic embrace of simplicity. In an industry that often celebrates complexity and demands mastery of intricate game mechanics, this title stands as a testament to the beauty of the uncomplicated. It shows that a game need not be filled with convoluted systems or elaborate narratives to be a masterpiece. It revels in the idea that the ordinary can be extraordinary if we take the time to appreciate it.

Despite its apparent simplicity, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator offers a surprising sense of discovery. As new ducks gracefully spawn into the pool, you may find yourself eagerly anticipating their arrival, wondering about the patterns, colors, or behaviors they will exhibit. This sense of curiosity and the delight in the unexpected adds a layer of depth to the experience, ensuring that each playthrough feels fresh and filled with delightful surprises.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator possesses a universal appeal that knows no boundaries. Whether you're a seasoned gamer seeking a tranquil escape or someone entirely new to the world of gaming, this title welcomes you with open arms. It's an experience that transcends age, experience, and gaming preferences, offering solace and serenity to all who embark on this journey.

One of the game's most endearing qualities is the sense of community it fosters. The online community surrounding Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is filled with like-minded individuals who appreciate the art of relaxation. Players come together to share their duck-watching experiences, discuss their favorite moments, and even form virtual clubs dedicated to the joy of duck appreciation. It's a heartwarming testament to the power of a shared love for tranquility.

In a world marked by chaos and uncertainty, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator offers a form of soothing escapism that is both timely and invaluable. It transports players to a place of calm and serenity, providing a brief but essential respite from the demands of daily life. It's a digital refuge where the troubles of the world melt away, replaced by the tranquility of the duck-filled pool.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a celebration of stillness‚Äîa reminder that in the relentless pursuit of progress and achievement, there is also beauty in simply being. It encourages players to pause, take a deep breath, and embrace the quiet moments that often go unnoticed in the rush of everyday life.

Despite the game's seemingly uniform premise, the diversity of ducks that grace the pool is remarkable. From the different patterns each duck can exhibit, to even some gimmicks that are unique to that specific duck. It's a testament to the developer's commitment to infusing depth into even the most straightforward aspects of the game.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is not just a game; it's a timeless experience that will resonate with players for years to come. Its enduring appeal lies in its ability to provide solace and joy in any era, transcending the boundaries of gaming trends and technological advancements.

In a world that often values high-intensity entertainment, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator stands as the pinnacle of relaxation in gaming. It reminds us that gaming can be a source of tranquility, an opportunity to unwind and find peace in the simplicity of the virtual world.

In conclusion, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is nothing short of a masterpiece, deserving every inch of its 10/10 rating. It is a game that defies convention, a digital oasis of serenity in a world that rarely slows down. Through its elegant simplicity, stunning visuals, and the mesmerizing charm of watching ducks in a pool, it invites players to experience a profound sense of tranquility and mindfulness. It is a game that speaks to the heart, reminding us of the beauty that can be found in stillness and simplicity. Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a tranquil masterpiece, an experience that should not be missed by anyone seeking a moment of respite and serenity in the world of gaming.

For this review i want to give a bit of background on myself to properly explain the effect this game has had on me. I'm 19 but i was raised by the internet, basically an early ipad kid before those became common. as a consequence of that i have been conditioned to consume content excessively and struggle to find the drive to create art or come up with creative ideas on my own. This game though has made me learn how to find joy in something simple and slow. I have spent hours just watching my ducks float around aimlessly while i craft personalities for them in my head, letting go of my desire for control and simply appreciating the mundane. along with personalities i come up with stories between my ducks, imaginary rivalries and plot threads. and on top of all this i can just enjoy the aesthetics and wonderful atmosphere that the game provides. I know i sound melodramatic but i legitimately love this game and think it teaches a valuable lesson in letting go of control and finding joy in tiny things. its a rare and unique gem that has had a big impact on me.

It reminds me of the old school story-style screensavers you used to buy if you wanted something beyond the pipes and bouncing windows logo for a screensaver.  It's rubber duck zen randomness. Expect nothing, enjoy the ducks.

REVIEW #71
Placid Plastic Duck Simulator
----------

PPDS is barely a game, but it's still a fun and calm experience. The premise is simple: lounge around a swimming pool where rubber ducks will occasionally drop in, and you can "collect" all duck types over time. The ducks mostly do nothing except drift around, occasionally moving down water slides and up tubes to bob around the different levels of the pool.  There are a couple of ducks that have special properties, like stone ducks that instantly sink to the bottom of the pool or firefighter ducks that squirt water on occasion. Rare events will happen, like cruise ships sailing by or UFO sightings, and these can sometimes result in special ducks appearing in your pool.

Overall, there's not much to Placid Plastic Duck Simulator, but I still enjoy just having it run on my PC while I do something in the same room. The interesting background music and overall atmosphere of the "game" make it fun to just watch or even keep running like a screensaver. It also doesn't hurt that it's dirt cheap ($2 USD at time of review.)

!!!!!Chilli con carne recipe!!!!!

if you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding Chilli con carne recipe you've come to the right place,

Ingredients

1 large onion
1 red pepper
2 garlic cloves
1 tbsp oil
1 heaped tsp hot chilli powder (or 1 level tbsp if you only have mild)

1 tsp paprika
1 tsp ground cumin
500g lean minced beef
1 beef stock cube
400g can chopped tomatoes
¬Ω tsp dried marjoram
1 tsp sugar (or add a thumbnail-sized piece of dark chocolate along with the beans instead, see tip)

2 tbsp tomato pur√©e
410g can red kidney beans
plain boiled long grain rice, to serve
soured cream, to serve

Directions

STEP 1
Prepare your vegetables. Chop 1 large onion into small dice, about 5mm square. The easiest way to do this is to cut the onion in half from root to tip, peel it and slice each half into thick matchsticks lengthways, not quite cutting all the way to the root end so they are still held together. Slice across the matchsticks into neat dice.

STEP 2
Cut 1 red pepper in half lengthways, remove stalk and wash the seeds away, then chop. Peel and finely chop 2 garlic cloves.

STEP 3
Start cooking. Put your pan on the hob over a medium heat. Add 1 tbsp oil and leave it for 1-2 minutes until hot (a little longer for an electric hob).

STEP 4
Add the onion and cook, stirring fairly frequently, for about 5 minutes, or until the onion is soft, squidgy and slightly translucent.

STEP 5
Tip in the garlic, red pepper, 1 heaped tsp hot chilli powder or 1 level tbsp mild chilli powder, 1 tsp paprika and 1 tsp ground cumin.

STEP 6
Give it a good stir, then leave it to cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

STEP 7
Brown 500g lean minced beef. Turn the heat up a bit, add the meat to the pan and break it up with your spoon or spatula. The mix should sizzle a bit when you add the mince.

STEP 8
Keep stirring and prodding for at least 5 minutes, until all the mince is in uniform, mince-sized lumps and there are no more pink bits. Make sure you keep the heat hot enough for the meat to fry and become brown, rather than just stew.

STEP 9
Make the sauce. Crumble 1 beef stock cube into 300ml hot water. Pour this into the pan with the mince mixture.


info.
This great chilli recipe has to be one of the best dishes to serve to friends for a casual get-together. An easy sharing favourite that uses up storecupboard ingredients.

To start, this review is not complaining about the central design of the game. With the price of the original game itself, I have no quarrels. It's only $2, and it's just trying to be a cute little idle game. They even added multiplayer lobbies, which can help add a lot of neat fun to the game. Yes, you don't "do" anything in the game except watch ducks and open presents. I have no issues with that. 
The same can not be said for the DLC.
It's baffling to me that you have to pay for the DLC for this game. I wouldn't mind if the DLC added something interesting to the game and was at a fair price, but all the DLC just adds new duck skins and a few levels. The fact that each bit of DLC is just as expensive as the base game is ridiculous. If you wanted to buy all the DLC as well as the base game, it would cost about 10-12 dollars. For me, I'm an achievement hunter. I got all the achievements when the most recent DLC was quaking the ice. I got all the achievements, and was dumbfounded when I checked back a month or so later, and basically saw that I would have to turn over a couple bucks to get my completion back. As I'm writing this review, there's even more DLC I'd have to buy to get 100% completion. I don't mind developers adding more content to ruin people's completion of their games. I myself have plenty of games in my library that have done that. However, it's insulting to make people fork over even more money for pretty much nothing substantial content-wise if they want to maintain 100% completion.

Overall, I have no issue with the game itself, but it would mean the world to me and I'd assume a lot of other people if the devs could either price the DLC fairly or make it free, rather than forcing us to pay a $12 package for something only really worth a couple bucks.

When I first saw this game on my feed, I wanna say around July-ish... I was not amused. 2 dollars, for a game where you sit down and do nothing but watch digital ducks in a pool? No touching them, or moving them? LAME.

Then, in August, I caved and bought it.

I was wrong. I was so wrong. When I played it, it makes sense. These ducks, these serene and gentle ducks... they mean the world to me. They quack, they float... they do it all. I felt myself growing bonds. I named them after friends. I began to narrate their lives, filling in the void.

This isn't just a game... it's an experience.

I originally invested in this game because I saw the price was low and if I got bored I wouldn't feel bad about spending the money.

Now I can't imagine life without this game.  Such a small investment for such a life changing experience.

I've lived a life of struggle.  A life filled with regret.  Haunted by my life decisions near constantly.  The moment that first duck dropped down into my pool, I felt relief.  I felt.. alive.  True tranquility.

As each new duck landed in my pool, I felt emotions that I had bottled up for a lifetime come flowing out like the water slide in the game.  I realized I wasn't living my truth.   I got divorced shortly after and sold my cats.  Because why would I let my ex-wife have the cats?

Now I just watch the ducks.  The ducks that are always there.  They will always come back and they will always be there for me.  They won't ever let you down.  All you need is ducks.

10/10 would have a breakdown again. 

Seriously though, this game has such charm to it and I immediately love every single little duck that enters my pool. Can already tell I will be putting more hours into this game and can't wait to discover all of the ducks and see how it develops further!

This software comes so, [i]so[/i] close to being the rubber duck experience I've wanted since seeing that PlayStation 3 tech demo with the duck moving around in a bathtub filled with the wettest water since the last wettest water. (Search "ps3 rubber duck demo" on YouTube for reference)
As far as I'm concerned, the only thing that's really missing is the ability to immediately fill the pool with so many ducks that they spill over the top, although directly controlling the ducks would be nice and it would be [b][i]really[/i][/b] cool if that part with the real-time motion detection for those cups were to be put in somehow!

Update after so many hours: My enjoyment has gone up significantly after getting my hands on a space-age gaming laptop with enough power to do 60 FPS, and the ducks are also unironically the cure to my insomnia. Now if only they would put in a sleep timer...

Another update after even more hours: I'm hopelessly obsessed, go nominate it for the Steam Awards and validate my insanity

There isn't really any gameplay to this "game". There's a couple little hidden puzzles or easter eggs or whatever, but mostly your options only consist of waiting for things to happen and looking at the different ducks.

It's great for reducing anxiety and I love leaving it on one monitor while listening to a podcast or watching a movie on the other screen. After all, if you temporarily have devote all your attention to the other thing you're doing, the ducks won't mind. Sometimes it's a good life lesson to just take a step back, remember that some things are out of your hands, and let the rubber ducks take care of things.

Overall a great way to unwind. It forces you to slow down, not take things too seriously, and just watch the ducks go by.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator ‚Äì A Hilariously Horrifying Dive into the Abyss of Inanimate Insanity!

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ 

If you've ever stared into the vacant eyes of a rubber duck and thought, "What if this thing is secretly plotting my demise?" ‚Äì well, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator has heard your paranoid quacks and cranked them up to eleven.

From the moment you launch this game, you're greeted by the unsettling squeak of rubber on virtual water, setting the tone for the psychological mind-boggle that lies ahead. Forget fluffy clouds and rainbow bridges; this is a world where the benign becomes bizarre, and your childhood bath toys are now emissaries of existential dread.

Visually, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator boasts graphics so realistic you'll question whether you're playing a game or having an existential crisis. The plastic ducks are meticulously detailed, each one with a face that could give Chucky a run for his money. The water, now an ominous pool of quivering uncertainty, reflects the unnerving truth that lies beneath the surface of the seemingly innocent bath time companions.

Gameplay involves navigating a bathtub filled with malevolent plastic ducks that seem eerily aware of your every move. The rubbery adversaries engage in conspiratorial quacks, creating an atmosphere more tension-filled than a Hitchcock film ‚Äì except, you know, with ducks.

The game's music and sound effects are unreal too, amazing vibe and sounds that have me grooving throughout the day.

As you progress through the different maps (most locked behind DLC), you'll uncover a plot thicker than the bubbles in a bubble bath. Cryptic messages written in foamy bubbles hint at a dark secret, a conspiracy involving the very essence of rubber duck existence. It's a narrative so convoluted, you'll find yourself questioning the nature of reality and the sanity of your own bathtub.

In conclusion, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a surreal journey into the depths of bathtub-based horror. It successfully transforms the mundane into the absurd, proving that even the most innocent childhood memories can be warped into a quacktastic nightmare. So, don your virtual snorkel, embrace the suds, and prepare for a rubber ducky showdown that will leave you questioning the very fabric of your bathtime reality. Quack, or be quacked!

God I love this game.

No but seriously. This is quite possible the best Idle/relaxing game there is on steam. I genuinely don't have one negative thing to say about this game. 

Pros: 
- Relaxing music. Great game to have up while studying, working, or just hanging out. It's incredibly comforting. 
- SO MANY DUCKS. And they're all amazing in their own way. You'll definitely have favorites, but you'll honestly never not be excited to receive a new duck. 
- Graphics are a big thumbs up and I wasn't expecting much considering it's an idle game. But it's amazing. 
- Achievement Hunters: Easy achievements. Leave your game running for several hours and you'll have the tools you need to obtain every achievement. Don't like my hour count fool you. You could probably get all the achievements in... I'll say 24 hours but that accounts for bag RNG. Good RNG may make it a shorter time frame. 
- Family friendly! Good for everyone!
- Clever Easter Eggs! More being found everyday and some we still haven't completely figured out yet!
- The most peaceful community I've ever seen. 

Cons: 
- I'll never get to experience the joy of playing it for the first time again. (until they release more DLC) 

I love this game. It's my go to for when I'm working from home just to have up in the background. 10000/10 game. This is not a meme. This is not a joke. I'm dead serious. Best $2 I've ever spent and I can honestly say I would've paid more for it. It's single handedly fighting my depression.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator has become a peculiar yet cherished fixture in my daily routine. There's a unique and indescribable charm in watching those rubber ducks lazily drift in the pool, and over time, they've become more than just virtual entities ‚Äì they're my digital companions, my quirky family.

Closing the game feels like bidding farewell to loved ones, and the resistance to parting ways with those floating ducks has become a daily ritual. It's not a matter of completing levels or achieving objectives; it's about savoring the simplicity of their aimless journey. Leaving the game open has become a conscious choice, allowing the ducks to perpetually navigate the serene waters in an unending loop of tranquility.

There's a strange but heartwarming connection that has developed. I find myself caring for these virtual quackers as if they were my own, each drift across the screen filling me with a sense of oddly genuine joy. The lack of complexity in the game is its strength ‚Äì it's an open canvas for forging a relationship with these rubber companions, and I've embraced it wholeheartedly.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator transcends the conventional definition of a game. It's a digital haven where my love for these rubber ducks knows no bounds. They've become my feathered confidants, and the prospect of closing the game feels akin to parting with family. In a world filled with intricate narratives and challenging quests, this simplistic simulation has carved a niche in my heart, offering a quiet escape into the comforting embrace of rubber duck companionship that I never knew I needed.

The best part of this game is that I put it on in the background of my class when I don't have to use the Promethean board/projector/whatever is working at the time, lol. The kids love having ducks on in the background, and those that get done quickly love watching (and those that don't do anything anyway actually have something to watch). I love it; they love it, and even the class lizard loves it (I teach high school). 

10/10 will use and keep using. Perfectly mindless, endlessly adorable, and beautifully entertaining.

This game is extremely fun and 100% deserves its reviews, it costs basically nothing and is a special kind of game, if you think you are about to get some action and explosions you are wrong, but this game gives something other games don't, it lets you just sit back, relax and stop worrying about winning or completing a certain task, somehow this game gives you only 2 types of control (camera movement, and quacking) and yet while playing you don't feel a need for more control, these days games make our attention span short and we get used to constantly having things going on or else we get bored immediately, this game somehow completely cured that for me, I just immediately had fun looking at the cute ducks and enjoying the lovely environment.

This game doesn't cost a significant amount of money yet you might find yourself enjoying it a lot more than you originally thought, if you tend to sit around being bored of the games you already have, you can just open this game with some snacks and a drink, get in a discord call with your friends and just enjoy the ducks swimming around in the beautiful swimming pool.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is an absolute gem in the world of video games! From the moment I started playing, I was captivated by its unique and enchanting charm. This game is an absolute masterpiece, and I cannot sing its praises enough.

First and foremost, the graphics in Placid Plastic Duck Simulator are breathtaking. The attention to detail in creating a world that is both whimsical and immersive is truly remarkable. The plastic duck characters are incredibly well-designed, each with their own distinct personalities and characteristics. It's evident that the developers put a lot of thought and effort into making this game visually stunning.

The gameplay itself is a delight. Watching your plastic duck through various levels and challenges is both fun and surprisingly relaxing. There's something oddly soothing about guiding your duck through tranquil ponds, serene lakes, and other picturesque environments. The game's physics engine is top-notch, making the movement of your duck feel realistic and enjoyable.

One of the standout features of Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is the sound design. The tranquil background music and the soothing quacks of your plastic duck add to the overall serenity of the game. It's the perfect escape from the daily hustle and bustle of life.

The variety of activities and challenges within the game keeps it fresh and engaging. From racing other ducks to solving puzzles and collecting items, there's always something new to explore and enjoy. The replayability factor is high, as you can always come back for more and try to beat your previous scores.

The development team behind Placid Plastic Duck Simulator deserves all the accolades they can get. It's evident that they poured their hearts and souls into creating this delightful game. It's clear that they wanted to give players an experience that's not just entertaining but also deeply therapeutic and heartwarming.

In conclusion, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a stunning video game that stands out as a true work of art in the gaming world. Its exquisite graphics, soothing gameplay, and overall charm make it a must-play for anyone looking to escape into a world of serenity and fun. I highly recommend this game to gamers of all ages ‚Äì it's a true masterpiece that brings joy and tranquility to those who play it.
never played a game that was better den this before and never would, this is peak perfection

I have never played a game more beautiful and amazing as this one. I bought it after losing my wife and kids in a car accident and it has completely changed my life for the better. Whatever depression I was struggling with is gone and I think now, because of this game, I am ready to move on and start a new family. This game has become my life. I love this game. For only $2 you can let this game change your life as well. Thank you again, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator for making my world brighter and happier for such a low cost.

In the vast realm of video games, there are those rare gems that transcend mere entertainment, leaving a profound impact on the lives of players. "Placid Plastic Duck Simulator" stands as one such masterpiece that not only captivated my imagination but also catalyzed a transformative journey. This unassuming game, with its serene setting and simple premise, unveiled a world of introspection, mindfulness, and unexpected life lessons.

The Oasis of Tranquility

From the moment I immersed myself in the ethereal world of Placid Plastic Duck Simulator, I was transported to a tranquil oasis that provided respite from the chaos of everyday life. The serene pond, nestled amidst a lush, idyllic landscape, became my sanctuary. The gently rippling water, the rustling leaves, and the distant call of birds formed a symphony of serenity that resonated within my soul.

Unearthing the Power of Mindfulness

At its core, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a testament to the art of mindfulness. Through the simplest of interactions with the plastic ducks, I learned to be present in the moment. Each quack, each graceful glide, became an invitation to be fully aware, to savor the nuances of existence that often go unnoticed in the rush of modern life.

As I guided my virtual self through the pond, I discovered that even the most mundane activities could be infused with a profound sense of purpose. The act of feeding the ducks, once a perfunctory task, evolved into a mindful ritual. With each morsel, I forged a connection with the virtual creatures, mirroring the deeper connections we form with the world around us when we approach it with intention and gratitude.

Embracing the Impermanence of Change

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator's dynamic weather system served as a poignant metaphor for life's impermanence. The shifting seasons, from the warm embrace of summer to the melancholy of autumn, reminded me that change is an inevitable and beautiful part of existence. It taught me to appreciate the ebb and flow of life, to find solace in the cyclical nature of experiences, and to recognize that every moment holds its own unique beauty.

Nurturing Empathy and Compassion

In the world of Placid Plastic Duck Simulator, the virtual ducks became more than mere lines of code; they became companions on my journey. Through subtle animations and interactions, I found myself empathizing with their virtual existence. Their quirks, their individual personalities, instilled in me a profound sense of compassion. This newfound empathy extended beyond the digital realm, urging me to approach the people and creatures in my own life with a deeper understanding and kindness.

A Catalyst for Real-Life Change

The lessons gleaned from Placid Plastic Duck Simulator transcended the confines of the virtual world, seeping into my daily life. I found myself more attuned to the beauty around me, more present in my interactions, and more open to the inevitable ebb and flow of life's currents. Through this unassuming game, I discovered a newfound sense of purpose and a deeper connection with the world and the people in it.

Conclusion

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator stands as a testament to the transformative power of interactive art. What began as a leisurely pastime evolved into a profound journey of self-discovery, mindfulness, and empathy. In the quiet ripples of the virtual pond, I found a reflection of my own evolving existence. This game, with its unassuming charm, forever etched its mark on my heart, reminding me that even in the most unexpected places, we can find the seeds of transformation.
gud gaym :)

This game has altered my perspective of life. 

Before I experienced Placid Plastic Duck Simulator I was miserable. But the moment I invested in this game, my life changed, everything got better.

 I discovered the meaning of life within my elongated Plastic Duck sessions. These sessions taught me how beautiful existence is, and the purpose for the small things in life. The simplistic art of the facile rubber ducks bobbing in the calm waves, and swaying in the soothing, serene breeze really brings a sense of tranquillity within the chaos of the outside world.

The concept of these indifferent creatures existing in the vast emptiness of nowhere, whilst still being joyful assisted me in understanding how much life really matters. All that is of significance in living is happiness. 

In conclusion Placid Plastic Duck Simulator has explained to me many lessons involving the meaning of everything. These lessons can be also be explained to you, if you buy this great game.

I love collecting different types of ducks and seeing them all socialize and go down the slide, then watch the fun sucking Zamboni take them all back up on a ski lift. It's more of an idle game if anything. If you're a streamer, you can just do Just Chatting and have this in the background. The ducks are all unique & adorable, AND you can name them all. Some of them make unique noises that are particular to the type of duck they are. 

When my boyfriend visits, we will play one game on the primary monitor and put this game in the background on the other. It's always a fun time with this game. 

[b]10/10 BUY ALL THE DLCS AND COLLECT ALL THE DUCKS. IT'S WORTH IT; I PROMISE YOU.[/b]

This game opened my eyes to the greater world outside the dull and toxic atmosphere of my former life,
it made me into a greater, more higher being,
I may of even reached Nirvana.

I look down on you now as you read this,
But at the same time we are as equals
But you look up to me.

I have felt emotion, betrayal, threat, love and pain through these ducks,
these ducks of love and war
i feel like the knife duck is after me but the stone duck is protecting my soul
protecting my soul from the harsh, cruel and unforgiving world.

The ducks remind me how time goes by so fast and yet we choose to ignore it,
what have we been doing with our lives if it wasn't for these beautiful, magical and lovely ducks
I feel like a peasant to a God when I see this in my Steam library

Unfortunately the side effects of these ducks are costly,
once you experience them once, twice, thrice or any infinite number of times
you will never peak in anything else.

Your mother gave birth to you or they specifically adopted you
or maybe it was your father
its any of those unless you're Batman
but I was responsible for my own birth, just to witness these ducks
and you are about to get a new parent, forget your old ones|
these ducks will be your new family.

I bid you farewell brave traveler, in these reviews of ducks and chaos, goodbye.

Have you ever wanted to do nothing? Well now you can! Even better yet, have you wanted to do nothing, but WITH rubber duckies of various suits and unique cosmetics? Well the waits over folks, now you can literally sit there and do nothing but watch little duckies float around in a relaxing environment and quack your little heart out. 
Not to even get you started on achievements, good gracious. You earn achievements on the FLY by doing NOTHING. (Aka... NOTHING) All the achievements I've gotten thus far, I have not a dang clue when i get them.
Various events can take place depending on what ducks you have on hand. I got an achievement for getting a floaty popped by the pool. Do I know how? Heck no i don't, why? Cuz I was doing NOTHING. 
Now even YOU can do nothing by yourself or with friends ONLINE! This game is nuts and I live for it. Its great for making you sleepy, or for those moods that you have no clue what game you wanna play. Just watch DUCKS!!
Even includes some nice background music to enjoy, however it does have some questionable ones, mainly on the first level where the relaxing music turns to either 1 of 2 odd tracks. 1 being just a lotta Spanish outta nowhere. The other being a deep voice also speaking some not-English language. 
We always got youtube if the music is less desired. 
GO WATCH YOU SOME DUCK!

[i]A n t i c i p a t i o n[/i]

The gameplay is best described as follows:
You are watching a pool. Once in a while a new random non-sentient, uncontrollable rubberduck from the game's collection enters the pool by falling from the sky. The next duck will take slightly longer to appear and will fall in the exact same position as all its predecessors. After hitting the pool, the ducks will act 'naturally' in the pool in accordance to their material attributes and will go with the flow of their environment and possibly interact with other ducks as they may have features that can influence the other ducks once they happen to encounter each other.

You can anthropomorphize your ducks by giving them clever names and imaginary personalities; pick favorites and anticipate their behaviors. 

The game feels unpolished and unoptimized at times. Glitching and visual flickering isn't rare, but considering this game was made on a very small production-scale it's a good experience that is being taken care of by its developer. 

You do not play this game; it's a fun screensaver that interacts with your creativity.
Enjoy.

An insightful game I must say, a game so deep and thought provoking, it challenges the likes of Plato, Confucius, Socrates, and Aristotle. The creators of this story, this narrative on one's heart and mind, should forever be engraved in the membrane and fabric of society. It speaks volumes to every ounce of your being, to bear witness to such an indescribable beauty is something to be eternally grateful for. These "placid plastic ducks" bring tears to the eye and soul, for their divine beauty is comparable to those accounts of seeing an angel descend from heaven; infinitely ethereal. And once you hear their perfectly sublime utterances of wisdom you cannot fathom an existence without it, "Quack, Quack." It is enough to bring the strongest galactic being to their knees (or the figurative equivalent) in heart-rending joy. You can be enthralled for millenniums by this game, and with the limitless emotion that this game evokes I cannot recommend it more. So, succumb to the eternal embrace of this masterpiece.
