This game changed my life for the better.

The dopamine you will get from watching these plastic ducks float around will be infinite, no mere words can describe the feelings of joy, terror and grief you will experience. These mere "ducks" are a force unknown to our world, so beautifull, so immense, so mysterious. The tiny amount of time I have used to experience this beauty of a "game" shows that even being there for such a short time makes you wonder what it means to be a duck or how to float around in life. This "game" is no mere game, it is an event, a grand ceremony for these placid plastic ducks to float around in life's water. This is the meaning of life, to watch to grow and to float around. If your worries are heavy, you will sink like the stone duck. May you have no worries at all, you will float away like the propeller hat duck. If you worry but not too much you will have a stable journey through life's challenges. 

Simply amazing.

After playing this game for over an hour, I've decided to put a review for it. I love it for two reasons: the goofy aspect and the relaxing aspect. 

The Goofy Aspect is great. Its especially hilarious to explain it to friends and family. I streamed it in my discord server and put in chat "totally not streaming rubber ducks", only for friends to join the stream and become confused. It was highly amusing. I do not wish to spoil, but there are a few moments in the game that left me feeling amused and entertained. It is literally a rubber duck version of watching the icon bounce around the TV and I find that absolutely hilarious. 

The Relaxing Aspect is also great. Watching little cute rubber duckies float around in a pool, listening to the splash of water and the relaxing radio music is calming for me. If you don't like the music you can always disable it and play your own music while gaming or listen to podcasts/audiobooks/etc. Upon loading the game I almost immediately felt de-stressed and calm. The day/night cycle is relaxing too. 

I recommend it if you are looking for a cheap relaxing game or a game to cause your friends intense confusion.

I came for just a nice relaxing live-desktop kind of game to play in the background while I'm at work and vibe to, and I definitely got that. But I also got some duck math out of this so that was cool. I hope more DLC worlds come in (as well as an official soundtrack), as the relaxing pool and relaxing snow den are wonderful places to just listen to their radios. Watching the ducks go down the slides is really relaxing, and I also love some of the random world events that cause the occasional drama. 

The sound ambiance in this game is beautiful, with relaxing waves/splashing and occasional quacking, with a radio on the main world which plays various relaxing mixes that are slightly ominous in tone, and various commentary from many radio hosts and showtunes in many languages. Russian(?), Japanese, English, reversed, and others play, allowing for a nice relaxing and surreal background noise for those who'd like it. There is also some excitement that is very slow burning, as some ducks have unique abilities and can affect others or the world around them, but I won't spoil that either.

A proper trial and error type of game, but not a game you will see much of unless you fancy a great deal of frustration.

It makes you use all your 3 remaining brain cells, 

Some key things that stuck out to me

-Thinking names for ducks (HARD) 
-Trying to find best viewing place (IMPOSSIBLE) 
-Wondering why one duck (it knows who!!!!) wants to be a total rebel? 
-EMOTIONAL when duck fly out the pool (You will CRY) 

Sometimes I want to be a duck?  Do you ever feel like that?

Absolutely FIRE!
The amount of Ducks you can get in the pool is incredible
The graphics are insanely well made and the map is big enough to fully enjoy the insanely well put together game
The controls were a bit hard to get used to in beginning, but after week of training, I Quacked.
The feeling of success was breathtaking, truly felt like a King.
Its perfectly suited to all ages and even has a party feature where everyone presses "space" to make the ducks Quack
I had so much fun playing this with all my family and we really had a blast
Truly got everyone together to experiance the soon-to-be Game of the year PLASTIC Duck Simulator.

I felt the way you likely do now: sale after sale, I hesitated to buy this "game.‚Äù Overwhelmingly Positive reviews be damned. Why shouldn‚Äôt I spend my cash on an actual game, like Vampire Survivors? (Because I already own Vampire Survivors. But you get the point.)

Here‚Äôs why: would you like as much heroin as you can possibly handle, with ZERO of the negative side effects?

Then watch iyashikei (‚Äúhealing‚Äù) anime like Yuru Camp, Non Non Biyori, Flying Witch, etc.

But also, buy this ‚Äúgame.‚Äù

The ducks gently and serenely bob up and down, like a luxury yacht on calm seas. Follow a duck, and your camera will gently bob up and down along with it. If you‚Äôve ever played a sailing game that made you motion sick, this is the exact opposite of that; play this to *stop* feeling motion sick, and start feeling as though you are being gently cradled into the tender bosom of a wondrous goddess of purest healing and love. (Yes, the aforementioned analogy is indeed about the camera movement. AAA-gaming industry, eat your heart out.)

But maybe that‚Äôs not your thing. Maybe you‚Äôd like to just chill in one of the comfiest chairs in existence, and watch your ducks serenely bob up and down, while you serenely remain stationary. Don‚Äôt worry: the dev has truly thought of everything.

And let‚Äôs not forget the slide, and the suction tube. If you thought that you couldn‚Äôt get dopamine hits from a game where you don‚Äôt really do anything, you probably never played with marbles. Or nature. But that‚Äôs okay, because now, you can look at ducks, which do marble-like things.

And oh, the ducks! I haven‚Äôt even started talking about the different ducks: as you have likely just surmised, there are indeed different ones. And you get a new one, every time! It‚Äôs like a gatcha machine, where you never lose! And you get to name them, and LOOK JUST BUY THIS GAME.

100% of the 98% Overwhelmingly Positive reviews sound like they were written by crazy people. Why? Because we probably are. So why not join us, and make it 99% Overwhelmingly Positive? Better than abusing actual heroin.
AMAZING GAME 10/10 i love the ducks.

Super cute game been playing it every day just about after work to unwind.

A cozy Idle game that's great to run in the background while you do other things. There is actually enough to see to keep you watching too. Game looks good. Lots of ducks to collect, lots of funny/hidden interactions, and possibly bigger hidden secrets. Pick it up. For the price, you wont be disappointed.
Quack

ever since I was born on my birthday I've always wanted to play a game I could call the best and after years of playing sub par games like Mario odyssey , breath of the wild, sonic mania, Hooters road trip on ps1, and the entirety of the God of War series I can say I have finally found a game more thrilling than the cut scenes and game play of God of War, more exploration than  breath of the wild could imagine, more fast pace platforming than ANY Mario or Sonic game COMBINED. this game not only has over 40+ playable characters but it also has a diverse and immersion grabbing sound track that can be heard via the radio beside the pool you start off in. There are no flaws in this game or about this game, from exhilarating game play to astounding price at only $1.99 (when at full price) but the fact that other boring games like God of War have the audacity to price them self at a much higher price around $60 as of the current date is completely ludicrous. This game has opened my eyes and has brought me to a higher state of being. Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is love, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is Life.

At some point one of the ducks got stuck in a flamingo float and blocked the upper pool side. We sat there for the longest time wondering if the float would ever move. We even started a poll in the stream to try and guess what would eventually unblock the slide so that the ducks could get down to the bottom pool again. Could the fire duck melt it? Would the wind blow it out of the way? 

Eventually the one little stabby duck ran into the flamingo float and there was much rejoicing. I had more average viewers watching this for TEN HOURS than I do on my Fortnite streams. I am now just a duck streamer. Thanks! Best investment.

Casual but relaxing game, great to have going while doing something else. When streaming the game, one of us would announce that a present had dropped, and then we all got to name the new duck!

Oh my goodness, where do I even begin?! The Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is an absolute masterpiece of a game! From the moment I started playing, I was completely entranced by the stunning graphics, the realistic sound effects, and the smooth, intuitive gameplay.

The attention to detail in this game is simply unparalleled. Every duck is perfectly rendered, every ripple in the water is flawlessly simulated, and every quack sounds like it's coming from a real, live duck. I felt like I was actually there, wading through the pond and watching the ducks swim by.

But it's not just the visuals and sound that make this game so amazing - it's the gameplay itself. The controls are so intuitive that I felt like I was born to play placid plastic duck simulator!

And the sheer variety of gameplay options is staggering. No matter what mood I was in, there was always something new and exciting to do in the Placid Plastic Duck Simulator.

Overall, I can't recommend this game highly enough. Whether you're a casual gamer or a hardcore duck enthusiast, you absolutely must try the Placid Plastic Duck Simulator. It's a truly unforgettable experience that will leave you quacking for more!

Fun and chill game! But sadly it's poorly optimized which can cause it to eat up your entire GPU when you try and play at 720p or even 480p if you're using an older build. For the price I would probably recommend it if you have 8gb memory or higher in your GPU so it'll work smoothly and still have plenty of memory to spare for other tasks. But I wanted to leave this review to warn people wanting to play that aren't using a very fancy setup. There's also a chance this issue has been fixed by the time you see this so if you REALLY want to play this (as you should) look into it.

I like to have it playing on my second monitor while working, every so often when I feel need a small break I like to grab something to eat/drink and just check on my ducks.

Plastic ducks floating in a pool, what more could you want? I have fun streaming this with friends

Here's the truth: you are either in the pool or you don't get it. If you look at this and ask yourself, "It is just plastic ducks floating around? Like, that's the *whole* game?" and the tone of the voice in your head doesn't have an echo of childhood glee, you don't get it - YET. 

Yes, at the core, it is just a bunch of plastic ducks floating around. Yes, it can be a pleasant relaxation, almost meditative type of experience. But can be so much more than that! You can some how form a bond with them and become invested in their well-being (No! Woody! Stay away from Lava! Why are you just bobbing there, Firefighter Duck?!) and create stories with them (those two are SO attracted to each other). Ducks become friends and rivals. New arrivals to the pool may turn out to be the life of the party or the bane of everyone's floating paradise. If you enjoy Sim games or tabletop role playing games, give this game 10 minutes.

Also, I cannot think of a more eloquent and well executed SIMPLE concept turned entertainment. It has gorgeous graphics, wonderful soundtrack (except the insanely loud wind), and the surprise interactions between some of the ducks are just plain joyful. It is incredible to see the attention to detail that was put into this project.
Very fun, and very relaxing.

Not a lot to write about for Placid Plastic Duck Simulator. You're a plastic duck, in the middle of water, just bobbing and slowly drifting around. You get to quack at least, but I would've also liked it if you were to just move around a little. There's a nice assortment of rubber ducks to be found here, adds a little variety and character to the ducks themselves.

I wouldn't really expect a lot for a 'game' such as this. Some nifty quirky events happen like a duck will be abducted by an alien, they'll make their way through a tunnel and sometimes get set on fire. Other than that, yeah you can't expect a lot to happen since it'll be a while until things do happen.

The only takeaway from this game is that it has no right in taking up so many system resources, particularly the GPU, as it does. Task Manager tells me that this game takes 50% of the GPU with power consumption on High. I've had graphically demanding games take less, while a stupidly simple idle simulator such as this takes up a bit. I don't understand that and I don't think it'll be fixed ever.

I want a neutral button for this based on that, but I'll not recommend it for the hardware portion while I'll recommend it for the novelty factor.

Two ducks arrived at my pool, one of wood and one of cloth. They began as strangers, but at time went by and the breeze in the summer sky changed, so did their circumstances; they were blown towards each other and it was love at first sight. They floated together for ages, rarely straying from one another. Even when they were apart, they always ended up reuniting with one another in a beautiful display of petroleum passion; things were perfect.

But then came another, one with a burning hatred for the life of lonliness he led. For though the pool was a world of joy and love, he felt none. Enraged, he began pursuing the two lovers, determined to make them feel the same pain that he had known for his isolated existance.

He set the wooden duck ablaze, the fire burning with the intensity of the jealousy of the relationship he yearned for, but could never have. It took only moments for the cloth duck to notice that their partner NAY, their very purpose of creation burning in agony and crying out to them. The cloth duck rushed to help, only to be ignited by the same destructive flames that now consumed the wooden one.

But neither would dare leave each other. for without one, the other could never be whole. So instead, they endured the pain, gazing into each other's eyes. Through the pain they felt as their plastic flesh became scorched, they endured. For the pain of living apart would be far worse than that of the flames.

They still float together, their dedication to each other brighter than even the most intense pool light, never to be snuffed out.

tl;dr 2 highly flammable ducks are inseparable for some reason and the lava duck hates them for it

I could just make a joke review like the others but I'll just make an actual review cause it's a nice game I want to talk about.

This is a neat little game to put on & relax to or to just check on here & there as it runs in the background. You don't need to do much just watch your pool's collection of rubber ducks grow(or shrink slightly since some escape into the sea). All you have to do is enjoy the scene & maybe switch between ducks or the pool chairs.

The rubber ducks are cute & have all sorts of odd/wild designs(WHO GAVE THAT THING A KNIFE). It's always interesting relaxing in the pool chair, wondering if the propeller hat one or the submarine one escaped before seeing a new duck join the party. The scenery also changes weather & stages of the day which can add for some great screenshots/photography moments especially at sunset. Also a few surprises pop up in the sea when in the base game's pool.


My only complaint is it gets a little buggy when you resume a save file as it lags a little then sends you to the game, sometimes if you accidentally/out of confusion click too many times the sky flickers between what you should see & black until the first duck lands. My first or second time resuming a saved game it crashed. I'm not sure if this has to do with the fact I'm on a laptop but aside from that it works fine.

Other than that I have no complaints & I'm happy to have bought this toy bird watching simulator. Will likely buy more duck DLC if it comes out.

Float with the cute ducks. Watch them bob around with their unfettered, zen-like placid smiles. Listen to the tunes. Smile at the silly jokes. Realize that there really is nothing that you need to do, but observe and be charmed. Stop worrying about missing things and just watch and enjoy what you see. Watch one duck for a full day night cycle. Then another. Give them names. Tell yourself, "I'll just wait to see what the next duck is," and end up staying for another 10.

Be calmed.

This game is so nice to be in the background as I'm doing other stuff away from my PC. I saw a Twitch Steamer play this game and I bought it soon after and never regretted it. I am having such a blast just watch these Rubber Ducks intact with each other as hijinx ensue. Without spoiling much, some of the ducks have powers of the elements that then effect the other ducks. The best part is that you get to name them  whatever you want (As far as I know for the whatever you want part), so I can personal scrutinize the troublemakers in the pool. I am so glad now, with the latest update to date, there are now save files so I can watch these plastic ducks from the different locations without fear of losing all of my "Rubber Duck Progress". Music is alright. There is a radio that plays random gibberish and some tunes. Most of the time though I just lower the sound as I try to get some work done outside of my PC. The graphics are beautiful. You can see the finest of details on the rubber ducks and the water itself. The textures look so good. There is a dedicated "Quack" button... YES! So overall, this is what I call an idle "game". All you do is watch rubber ducks, and then some. This is not for everyone, but if you need something serine in the background while your computer is not in any use or you want to watch funny rubber ducks and hijinx all day, it's worth picking up. The game and the DLC are very affordable, especially for a well polished game and the multitude of ducks. 100% the game is literally just sit and watching ducks, although there are special "Holiday Ducks" that I think would only appear around Christmas, so that might be the hardest part of "completing this game". 
Bottom line: Really good game, can watch ducks all day, 10 Quacks out of 10,

update: I wanted to make a post, but thought it was better to update my review

I will say I adore this game, I even bought this for a friend who loves ducks.

I won't lie, I haven't put that many hrs into it, and I may wait as a result of there being no real graphics option, as a result its not very well optimized.

For $2 its a steal, but I  can't really recommend to anyone even with a somewhat decent pc. Optimization options is something that the game clearly needs, yet lacks despite the amazing additions being made to the game along with 3 DLCs.  I liked the idea so much I even got my friend a copy.

That's my only concern, if not for the lack of graphics options I would continue to play this game, but I feel like playing this at a very low frame rate would be a shame so I am hoping sometime in the future these features will be added so me and my friend can enjoy this without performance issues

Ducks!

That is it. That's the whole game.

This game is one of the best games i have ever played. You would think it would get boring, just watching ducks for hours. But it doesn't! The ability to name your ducks and switch to different ones perspective is a good way to allow the players to make up their own stories about the small pool of ducks. It keeps you engaged all the time by adding more ducks to the pool, and even when you have all the ducks it still is an interesting game! The thrill me and my friends had when the first duck went down the slide was unprecedented. Also with the frequent updates and DLC the game gets, it doesn't get boring!
My literal only gripe with the game is that there is only one save file. I wish I could have more than one save file so I didn't have to restart with no ducks for the levels I already completed. But as I said that is my literal only complaint to this masterpiece of a game. If you are not playing this game you are missing out on one of the best gaming experiences of your life. 
11/10 would recommend to literally anyone. If you don't like this game, that's sad for you. You don't understand the complexity of this ambitious cinematic masterpiece, THIS GAME ISN'T STUPID YOU'RE STUPID!!!
EDIT: they did change the only thing i didnt like about the game so i am happy with this new update, but... i am SEVERELY disappointed with the removal of my FAVORITE song on the soundtrack. it was  replaced with a vastly inferior song. that song just had a vapor wave kinda vibe that i loved, i miss it a lot. but other than that i will keep playing this game till the end of time

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is a tour de force of artistic achievement. The beauty of a sunset and sunrise. The blissful vaporwave calm of softly lit pool while quiet lo-fi radio plays in the background. And last but not least, a fuck ton of plastic ducks. Which you can name. And some have special powers. And did I mention you can name them? 

The suspense as I watch for specific interactions! The bliss as I gently glide around the pool! The freedom when a duck escapes and rockets off to the great wide world!

Five stars to Placid Plastic Duck Simulator. Genuinely pleasant and calming to watch (I mean play) while I do other things.

This is not just a game. Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is an entire experience; an experience in which you, the player, will be riding on a roller coaster of emotions. A duck might stray away from the safety of the pool to wander the vast ocean, or fly off a cliff just to see where they end up. A new duck may be born, or one may visit from a faraway land. Each duck does not physically show any personality, but they all have one, and you can tell just by glancing at them. The suspense of waiting for a new duck to arrive is unimaginable, and the pure bliss of when the duck comes is incredible. The beauty of it all is how the game is somewhat simple, but also deep and rich with story. When I say this is the best financial decision I've made, I mean it. Just playing the base game for a few minutes was enough to persuade me to buy all of the DLC's. If you are looking for something life changing and happened to stumble upon this steam page, trust me, buy it.

I appreciate the modesty of the developers, given that the game doesn't require you to do anything. This is very accurate and true to the nature of the plastic duck as they literally just float around. You can get them to quack or pan the camera around, switching ducks if you'd like but I had to stop playing because the ducks kept spawning in and it eventually lags my pc.

This could have been avoided if the developers allowed me an option to only spawn in ducks that don't do anything except float, as there would be no effects being rendered or interactions between ducks and at the very least it would take far longer for them to make a performance impact IN MY OPINION. Now while I haven't got that option the devs have added the next best thing with the latest patch, the ability to turn off ducks spawning in.

Word to the wise, the game is only worth it if you really like plastic ducks or are bored enough to sit there and watch them from time to time. To be fair it isn't actually that bad, just that the radio keeps on repeating itself very frequently and leads to me pressing M (mute) while "playing" the game.

I recommend this because it is accurate to the game description and plays exactly as one would expect after reading it.

This ducking game. I have tasks in DDV waiting, various bad guys that need killing and princesses /tribes/ countries /worlds that need saving in other games, and don't ask about the real world laundry pile and TBR mountain. But I can't seem to drag myself away from the ducks. Will Tartan McDuck survive the dragon's fire? Will Daisy the Cow Duck ever return from her holiday on Alpha Centauri (or at least send me a postcard)? How many hours/months of play will it take to displace all the water with stone and marble ducks? Will the ducks ever reach mass critical enough to break through the ice? What is behind that door? Will my Deck melt before I find out?

Recommended, but don't blame me (or the devs) if you have no clean underwear because you watched ducks instead of doing laundry.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is by far the most entertaining game on Steam and has an extremely intricate plot.
Here are just a few examples of the shenanigans that have occurred in the 5 hours I have played this game for:
 -My duck Gertrude gave birth to triplets, and another duck got abducted by aliens and replaced with an alien duck.
 -Timmy is determined to cross the ocean. Why? Is there someone across the ocean he wishes to find? Friends? Family? A crush? I will never know. He left and cannot return.
 -My ducks Roople VI, a firefighter, and Existential Crisis, a submarine duck, became best friends, but Roople VI was captured by the ruthless flamingo. Roople VI went mad trying to find a way out and abandoned Existential Crisis, which made Mr. Crisis swim into the ocean in search of better friends.
 -A speedy duck, Grandma's Curtains, rammed into a duck so hard that is flew into the ocean, and felt no shame about it.

If you are looking for a game with the same absurdity as the plot of Riverdale, I highly suggest this game.
100% worth the money and my laptop definitely isn't at 80% GPU :)

Highly recommend this game as someone who enjoys idle, cozy games with vaporwave aspects and naming things. I named a bunch of ducks, I listened to the radio, I sat in the hotspot poolside chair (even though I didn't have any legs), and I watched what happened when certain ducks got close to other ducks. I was distraught to see some ducks find freedom, but shouldn't we be proud of them for leaving the nest? I made stories for my little ducks, and entertained my friends with this game. I can see myself turning this on over and over again, even after collecting all the ducks.

I purchased this game after watching RTGame playing it 2 months ago (Note: I wasn't actively watching it, so the ducks were all a surprise for me) and only just installed it three days ago. I played it off and on mostly while eating and just letting it go in the background and being really enjoyable. 

At some point I jumped in a call with my best friend while sharing my screen and she had to go do chores so I decided to quickly launch up this game again while waiting, she came back and was watching what I was doing for a bit before unmuting and asking what am I doing, and then...

We've been actively waiting for more ducks. We're going crazy. We've figured out family trees and paired ducks off together. We're making backstories and discussing about which ducks our OC's (original characters) would be their favorites... we've even started making ducks have a storybeat in our story and kinda wanna make them easter eggs xD

tl;dr - play with a friend and you'll have a wild time


The only negitive thing that I dislike about this game, and it almost made me uninstall it, is that if you re/start a new pool your previous pool will be gone - along with all your ducks, so you'll have to get them all over again. Bottom Line Up Front: yes, this is a rubber ducky screensaver passing as a game BUT it also has physics and a soul.

Look, I don't know how to describe this game to the uninitiated.  I picked it up on a sale and a whim - really wasn't expecting much out of it.  Did the install, fired it up, and about 10 mins into the game, I thought: "Jesus another wasted couple bucks..." but then.... it happened.  
It was something about the focus I had on one duck, another duck must have passed in the foreground, pushing the camera just into the right angle: a close up of a perfectly textured duck, the sun was setting, the palm trees were looming over the duck's back, and the pool's radio let the beat dropp.... .... ....  I couldn't describe it - i still can't describe it.  Its like all of a sudden the game...THIS GAME... it all made sense.  It felt like my heart.... my heart... do you remember play Smash Bros as Ness, and hitting a 250% Jigglypuff with the bat and it the sound it made?  That PAAAINGGG!!!!!  That happened - but to my soul.  The textures and the lighting... it just blew me away.  I tried to screen cap the moment, but I couldn't capture it through my tears.  I have been playing this game ever since...trying to recapture that moment.  The glimmer...  but it was so fleeting.  I was not ready for this game.  I feel like I am chasing a ghost....

Look, I am writing this because it could be the last thing I will ever say.  I'm not sorry, I had it coming... hope for my future is now a still born dream... i'm rushing to meet my love... please remember me... there is no more...

This game has changed my life for the better. It has turned my life around. This game has enlightened a spark inside of me that has given me the motivation to achieve what I thought was unachievable. This game has encouraged me through the hardest of times and has empowered me to make decisions that have ultimately changed my life for the better. I doubt you will come across anything in your entire existence on this Earth that will make you happier than this exquisite game, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator. I have also noticed several physical changes in my body since I began my journey in this game. My biceps are decidedly far more awesome than they were prior to my initial installation of this game. Thank you so much to the people involved with the development of this game for saving me from my rut of seemingly inescapable sadness and despair.

Imagine a classic fish tank screensaver, but instead of fish, it's duckies in glorious 3D. Each one looks different and may include some special traits, like flammability or the ability to fly. They are collected as they randomly appear.

There are a couple of achievements that bring sense of progression, which I enjoyed (as long as I didn't have to wait for hours to unlock the next one). However, there's a catch: you do nothing but watch and relax, so it's up to them to unlock achievements for you.

Lighting and reflections look fantastic. The swimming pool has a dreamy retro aesthetic to it and the duckies are colourful and pretty. The music gets repetitive after a couple of hours since the radio is only a 30 minute loop, but it will be reworked soon.

Would squish again! The DLCs are absolutely worth getting too, as they greatly improve upon the base idea.

Overall this game is a fantastic game for people who enjoy philosophy. 10/10

RELAXING

For the price, there isn't much to complain about. It was a fun enough game. Perfect background ambiance to toss on the TV when you have family over. That or cleaning the house. 
The problems start to come with the DLC, these cost as much as the full game each and either have just 20ish ducks and nothing else, or a stage and only 4 ducks.  
Which I bought both. Played both. Unlocked all the ducks in a day and moved on with my life. 
I only load it up periodically, like if I need something in the background or notice an update coming through. 
Which it had. One that removed a holiday event I hadn't known had started. 
This event added as much content as either of the DLCs I paid for, though for free which would be nice. Only the event pack is no longer available, the missing ducks however stay as incomplete ghost ? Shadows in my collection menu. 
I wouldn't mind missing the event, if it was removed, but those that played it got to keep it. Those who had no clue it was going on and missed it do not. Yet we still get to see we missed it every time we play. 
So I reached out about this issue to the devs, who said "please only use the issues/bug channel for bugs" then when I asked if there was a place for feedback I was told "I read your comment" which was better than how some other members responded to my request. 
What might seem like a little thing to some people can be game ruiningly frustrating to another. 
If this is an indication of content updates to come I regret paying for such skimpy DLC offerings. 
I was originally happy to support such a wonderful idea. Though if my money is used on content that gets locked away because of events, and I have no way to know about these events, then I feel cheated everytime I load my collections page.
So my review in summary, buy the base game. Skip the DLC. Play it for a bit then uninstall it once you had your fill.

Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is an exceptional game that I have had the pleasure of playing. The level of difficulty is ungodly, but that only adds to the satisfaction of mastering the gameplay. The game requires a high level of skill and offers an immersive experience. The attention to detail is unmatched, and I am eagerly awaiting the release of any DLC. I highly recommend Placid Plastic Duck Simulator to anybody looking for a challenging and engaging experience.

I initially bought this game for myself and one of my friends as a joke, as I knew that you didn't do anything. However, after staring it up, I became addicted. Me and my friend quickly became addicted and other friends began to buy the game also.

The game is oddly relaxing, satisfying, and addictive. It's worth the price, and you are likely to play it for longer than you think you will.

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

it is almost a negative review due to the 'Putting Challenge' achievement issue, but the fast Developer's help changed that.
(Btw, I don't understand why they couldn't code this achievement bug for months.)
So if you're an achievement hunter, you have to prepare for suffering to obtain 100%.

Plus, you also have to purchase the 2 new DLCs to accomplish the game on 100% after they had released end of 2022 and their contain new achievement packs. 

Plus, you also have to purchase the 2 new DLCs to accomplish the game on 100% after they had released end of 2022 and their contain new achievement packs. 

1. called 'DUCKS, PLEASE‚Äô contains 4 cheevos: 
Floatpiercer, Firequackers, Beeline, and the Magnetic feel. 
[i] (TIP: You can ALSO reach them in the other DLC/winter map, but it's FASTER if you choose the base map and the 'Ducks, Please' duck collection ONLY. [/i]

2. 'QUACKING THE ICE' contains 6 cheevos: 
Off-piste ski, Quacking the ice, Fun-fun-funicular, Hot Tub, Campfire simulator, and the Scoring Challenge.
[i](Well, so I would continue this part willingly, but it's just a review, not a Guide.)[/i]

So... The expected total playtime of base game is about 10 hours, the 2 DLCs another 10-20, and finally 10-20 hours for 100% with much cry because of first mentioned achievement.

I recommend you purchase the game or the pack on sale only. According to my purse they are  ridiculous at full price. 

Besides the above I just can say one more really IMPORTANT thing about the game:

Take your time. 
Tick-Quack. 
Relax much.
Rock. Quack.
[b]Enjoy your life.[/b]

There aren't enough words to describe this game, but I suppose some could call it a master piece. While playing this game I was surrounded by the semantic field of serenity enclosed in a pool of my own thoughts; watching my ducks float, listening to the music fill my headset, and trying to find hidden meanings. I still do not understand propeller ducks goals or how he invented such technology; I can only sit and run this game patiently waiting for him to return. I would not dare turn this game off; the thought of missing out on an event only I was patient enough to see fuels me and drives me to be who I am. I am still yet to learn how the flamingo inflatable manages to edge itself closer to the pool, but witnessing events like these leads me to believe in the mountains the giant yeti duck may thaw out. Could yeti duck be the mother of all plastic ducks? Could yeti duck hold the secrets of all that has happened and all that is to come? I was hurt to see the audacious people negatively reviewing this game due to its usage of 98% of their gpus. I suppose they aren't, like the rest of us, worthy Placid Plastic Duck Simulator Enjoyers.

[quote=gcharles] Changing this to recommended, but still leaning towards a maybe simply because I can see that the dev cares and has explained a portion of my reason for it not being so. All in all, the game is as described on the store page, so I shouldn't have been surprised by that tidbit. I somehow was though, so I'll leave my original review in case anyone's interested in reading it. [/quote]

It's more of a maybe rather than a no since I got what I, specifically, wanted [i] (achievements and +1 to my perfect games) [/i] but there's very little to the game. Given the connotation that "Simulator" games have, you'd think there'd be more to do, but it's quite the opposite. It's actually the purest idler I've ever played. The game certainly has potential, but I doubt the developer will take it any further. I'd suggest getting this when it's on sale like I did.

[b][u][i] What Tickles My Fancy [/i][/u][/b]
Even though I'm not exactly happy with the game, it still has some good qualities.
[list]
    [*] A well-built 3D environment that is, indeed, relaxing.
    [*] Various ducks with some having specialized abilities and sounds.
[/list]

[b][u][i] Got Any Grrripes? [/i][/u][/b]
There not being much to the game leaves me wondering what the game could be...
[list]
    [*] Huge GPU hog. At my highest resolution (2560x1440@164Hz) it's taking up 80%-85% of my GPU. At the lowest resolution (640x480@59Hz) it's taking up 70%-75% of my GPU. And for what?
    [*] Nothing to do. You literally just watch ducks spawn in and float around. With the current Christmas event, you click a present to unwrap the duck, initially, but that's it.
    [*] Only one save at a time with no warning. Managed to reset my progress because I thought I could start a playthrough on the DLC map just to try and speed things up. Ended up adding 4 or so hours to my playtime just because of that, which was slightly upsetting.
    [*] The paid DLCs are required in order to 100% the game. While it's not much money, I've never been a fan of that.
[/list]

[b][u][i] For Achievement Hunters [/i][/u][/b]
In order to 100%, you literally just open the game and do something else in the meantime. This effectively makes the game a screensaver, as many have already described. Now... some achievements are extremely random, so I'll leave these here just in case.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2834018431] Achievement Guide [/url] by Bad Clown
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2903925213] How to get new achievements [/url] by ddarani
